definition[0]: a small piece of paper, plastic etc attached to something to show what it is, who owns it, what it costs etc
example[0]: All the staff wore name tags.
definition[1]: a children’s game in which one player chases and tries to touch the others
definition[2]: a piece of equipment that you attach to an animal or person, especially someone who has just left prison, so that you always know where they are
definition[3]: a computer code attached to a word or phrase in a computer document in order to arrange the data in a particular way
definition[4]: a word or phrase which is used to describe a person, group, or thing, but which is often unfair or not correct
example[1]: His speed earned him the tag of ‘the runner’.
definition[6]: someone’s name that they paint illegally on a wall, vehicle etc
definition[7]: the license plates on a car
definition[8]: a small piece of sticky plastic with a date on it that you put on your car’s license plate to show that the car is legally allowed on the road in that year
example[2]: Don’t forgot to remove the price tag.
example[3]: Every baby had a name tag on his or her wrist.
example[4]: Expensive items such as leather jackets have security tags which have to be removed at the till.
example[5]: You can buy gift wrap with matching gift tags.
example[6]: Was there a luggage tag on your suitcase?
definition[9]: to attach a tag to something
example[7]: Each bird was tagged and released into the wild.
definition[10]: to give someone or something a name or title, or describe them in a particular way
example[8]: The country no longer wants to be tagged as a Third World nation.
definition[11]: to attach a tag in a computer program or document
example[9]: All the words are tagged with their part of speech.
definition[12]: to illegally paint your name on a wall, vehicle etc
definition[13]: to touch someone you are chasing in a game, especially to touch someone with the ball in baseball
definition[14]: a series of letters or words that are put before and after a piece of electronic text to show that it is to be treated in a particular way
